revised_title: Absolute and Convective Instabilities of Spatially Periodic Flows: A Generalized Theory
tldr: This article presents a generalized theory for the evolution of linear wave packets in spatially periodic media, providing precise conditions for absolute and convective instabilities. The theory is applied to the finite-amplitude periodic traveling wave states of the real and complex Ginzburg-Landau equation, and the problem of unstable wave packets for the Navier-Stokes equations is also formulated.
